instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power up. green light on charger
threads.message:
i have here water damaged macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and is not powering up. i measure some rails and i got
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  - 8.36v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>  -  0.00v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>   - 16.87v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> -   3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>   - 5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> - 0.000v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power up. green light on charger
threads.message: Corrosion around <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> or <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR>, broken trace, check if there is continuity from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR>....
